enumList.name: ExtensionName
enumList.description: The names of agreed extensions to WITSML. This list may be locally extended but it is recommended that new names be approved by the WITSML SIG before use. Each standard name must define its data type. For string types, the maximum length must be defined in number of characters. For measures, the expected measure class must be defined.

value.name: dummy-example-string
value.description: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a string of maximum length of 64 characters which can be used in the commonData of any object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

value.name: dummy-example-measure
value.description: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a length measure which can only be specified in the commonData of the well and wellbore objects. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field. The extensionMeasureClass constrains the allowed units of measure for each value. The extensionDataType value of double constrains the size of each value.

value.name: dummy-example-dateTime
value.description: This is an example for the purpose of demonstrating the capabilities. This name should not be used and can be removed from a production file. It describes a dateTime value which can be specified anywhere in the tubular object. The semantics of the name would be defined in this description field.

enumList.name: LithologyType
enumList.description: These values represent the lithological terminology used in descriptions of rock cuttings in mud logs.

value.name: andesite
value.description: Intermediate porphyritic volcanic rock consisting of plagioclase, pyroxene, hornblende and bitotite.

value.name: anhydrite
value.description: The mineral form of anhydrous calcium sulfate, commonly massive in evaporite beds.

value.name: arkose
value.description: An indurated arenaceous deposit consisting chiefly of quartz and feldspar (>25%).

value.name: basalt
value.description: Volcanic rock consisting essentially of plagioclase feldspar and pyroxene.

value.name: breccia
value.description: A lithified rock rich in angular fragments of size greater than 2mm.

value.name: calcarenite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of cemented sand-size grains of calcium carbonate: a consolidated calcareous sand.

value.name: calcilutite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt and/or clay size: a consolidated calcareous mud.

value.name: calcisiltite
value.description: A limestone more than half of which consists of detrital calcite particles of silt size: a consolidated calcareous silt.

value.name: chalk
value.description: A fine-grained limestone composed largely of coccolith fragments.

value.name: chert
value.description: Siliceous sedimentary rock containing finely crystalline snd fibrous quartz.

value.name: clay
value.description: Unconsolidated deposit of very fine particles of size generally less than 1/256mm and composed of clay minerals.

value.name: claystone
value.description: An indurated clay, lacking the fissility of shale.

value.name: coal
value.description: A combustible organic sedimentary rock with less than 40% of mineral matter (based on dry material) composed of polymers of cyclic hydrocarbons.

value.name: conglomerate
value.description: An indurated sedimentary rock containing an essential quantity of rounded rock fragments larger than 2mm, and normally having a matrix of sand.

value.name: diabase
value.description: Igneous rock of grain size intermediate between basalt and gabbro composed of plagioclase feldspar, pyroxene and opaque minerals. Synonym: dolerite.

value.name: diorite
value.description: Plutonic igneous rock consisting of plagioclase feldspar, commonly with hornblende and biotite.

value.name: dolomite
value.description: Sedimentary rock containing more than 90% dolomite (mineral) and less than 10% calcite.

value.name: dolomite, calcareous
value.description: A dolomite rock containing more than 10% calcite.

value.name: extrusive rock (volcanic)
value.description: Igneous rocks formed by solidification of material erupted sub-aerially or sub-aqueously onto the earth's surface, as either lava flows or pyroclastic material.

value.name: feldspar
value.description: The family of aluminium silicates of sodium, potassium, calcium and other metals which comprise over 60% of the earth's crust, are the most abundant mineral group, and occur in all types of rocks.

value.name: gabbro
value.description: Coarse grained plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of calcic plagioclase feldspar, pyroxenes and iron oxide.

value.name: glauconite
value.description: A mineral composed of ferrous potassium silicates related to mica which commonly imparts a green color to its sedimentary host rock.

value.name: gneiss
value.description: A metamorphic rock, commonly foliated and crystalline, whose mineral content can range from quartz and feldspars to amphiboles and pyroxenes.

value.name: granite
value.description: Coarse grained plutonic rock typically containing free quartz, alkali feldspar and biotite mica.

value.name: gravel
value.description: An unconsolidated deposit of coarse clastics. The diameters on the Wenworth scale are generally greater than 2mm.

value.name: greenstones
value.description: A field term for any dark fine grained altered or metamorphosed basic igneous rock.

value.name: greywacke
value.description: A dark grey consolidated deposit containing feldspar, rock fragments and a dark chloritic matrix.

value.name: gumbo
value.description: A term used in the U.S. for clay soils that become sticky, impervious, and plastic when wet.

value.name: gypsum
value.description: A mineral composed of hydrous calcium sulphate, commonly forming thick extensive evaporite beds.

value.name: halite
value.description: A mineral composed of sodium chloride common in evaporite rocks.

value.name: igneous
value.description: Term applied to rock or mineral formed by solidification of molten or partly molten material (magma).

value.name: intrusvie rock (plutonic)
value.description: Igneous rock formed by cooling and solidification of magma within the earth's crust.

value.name: lignite
value.description: A low-rank humic coal.

value.name: limestone
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed mostly of the mineral calcite (calcium carbonate) which is the consolidated equivalent of lime mud, calcareous sand, and/or shell fragments.

value.name: limestone, argillaceous
value.description: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% clay minerals.

value.name: limestone, dolomitic
value.description: A limestone containing 10-50% dolomite and 50-90% calcite.

value.name: limestone, sandy
value.description: A limestone homogeneously mixed with 10-50% quartz grains.

value.name: marble
value.description: A metamorphic rock composed of calcite.

value.name: marl
value.description: A consolidated or semi-consolidated mixture of clay and generally fine grained carbonate material.

value.name: metamorphic rocks
value.description: Rocks formed by mineralogical, chemical and structural alteration of pre-existing rocks under conditions of temperature and pressure at depth in the earth.

value.name: mudstone
value.description: Consolidated and indurated mud.

value.name: no description
value.description: No description is provided.

value.name: no sample
value.description: No sample is provided.

value.name: ophiolite
value.description: Basic and ultra-basic igneous rocks and their metamorposed, often hydrated, derivatives, believed to represent former oceanic crust.

value.name: peat
value.description: Unconsolidated, semi-carbonised plant remains which are a precursor of humic coal.

value.name: phosphate
value.description: Any mineral compound containing the ((PO4)3) radical.

value.name: phosphate rock
value.description: Any rock containing phosphate minerals such as apatite of sufficient purity and abundance to be an economic resource.

value.name: potassium and magnesium salts
value.description: Salts such as sylvinite, carnalite, keiserite with swelling properties that can severely obstruct drilling operations.

value.name: quartzite
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed of more than 95% of quartz.

value.name: rhyolite
value.description: Silica rich volcanic rock consisting of quartz and alkali feldspar with minor plagioclase and biotite.

value.name: salt
value.description: Common term for naturally occurring sodium chloride.

value.name: sand
value.description: An aggregation of particles having diameters in the range 1/16mm to 2mm usually consisting of quartz.

value.name: sandstone
value.description: A sedimentary rock composed of indurated sand.

value.name: schist
value.description: A strongly foliated crystalline metamorphic rock.

value.name: serpentine
value.description: A rock forming mineral of hydrous iron and magnesium silicates, often resulting from metamorhism of amphiboles and pyroxenes.

value.name: shale
value.description: A fine-grained sedimentary rock formed by the compaction of clay, silt or mud.

value.name: silt
value.description: Unconsolidated sedimentary material with grain sizes between 1/16mm and 1/256mm.

value.name: siltstone
value.description: Consolidated silt.

value.name: slate
value.description: A compact fine-grained metamorphic rock displaying slaty cleavage along which the rock may be cut into sheets.

value.name: syenite
value.description: Plutonic igneous rock composed essentially of alkali feldspar, with lesser sodic plagioclase, biotite and hornblende, and minor quartz.

value.name: tillite (diamictite)
value.description: Consolidated unsorted glacial deposits with particles ranging from boulder to mud in grain size and of highly variable composition.

value.name: trachyte
value.description: A group of fine-grained often porphyritic volcanic rocks containing alkali feldspar and minor mafic minerals.

value.name: tuff
value.description: An indurated pyroclastic deposit, predominantly consisting of fine-grained volcanic rocks: sedimentary particles may be present. Tuff may be deposited sub-aerially or sub-aqueously, and may be well sorted or heterogeneous.

value.name: ultrabasic
value.description: A class of igneous rocks composed mostly of mafic minerals such as pyroxenes along with calcic feldspar, with no free silica and a total silica content less than about 45%.

value.name: undifferentiated
value.description: The lithology is not differentiated. This is typically used to fill out a lithology description to 100 percent.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: MeasureClass
enumList.description: Defines classes of measures and their allowed units of measures. For a value whose underlying meaning conforms to one of these classes, any specified unit of measure must conform to the defined list. These are copied from the Energistics (POSC) Units Classes v2.2. The units of measure map to the POSC Units of Measure Dictionary v2.2.

value.name: absorbed dose
value.description: The amount of energy absorbed per mass.

value.name: activity (of radioactivity)
value.description: A measure of the radiation being emitted.

value.name: concentration of B
value.description: molar concentration of a substance

value.name: amount of substance
value.description: molar amount of a substance

value.name: angle per time
value.description: The angular velocity. The rate of change of an angle.

value.name: attenuation
value.description: A logarithmic, fractional change of some measure, generally power or amplitude, over a standard range. This is generally used for frequency attenuation over an octave.

value.name: data transmission speed
value.description: used primarily for computer transmission rates.

value.name: delta temperature
value.description: Delta temperature refers to temperature differences. For non-zero offset temperature scales, Fahrenheit and Celsius, the conversion formulas are different than for absolute temperatures.

value.name: dimensionless
value.description: A dimensionless quantity is the ratio of two dimensional quantities. The quantity types are not apparent from the basic dimensionless class, but may be apparent in variations - such as area per area, volume per volume, or mass per mass.

value.name: electrochemical equivalent
value.description: An electrochemical equivalent differs from molarity in that the valence (oxidation reduction potential) of the element is also considered.

value.name: energy length per time area temperature
frequency interval
value.description: An octave is a doubling of a frquency.

value.name: gamma ray API unit
value.description: This class is defined by the API, and is used for units of gamma ray log response.

value.name: pH
value.description: The pH is a class that measures the hydrogen ion concentration (acidity).

value.name: pressure squared per force time per area
unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagLocation
enumList.description: Defines the locations where an equipment tag might be found.

value.name: body
value.description: The body of the equipment. For tubular components this specifies a location toward the middle of the component.

value.name: box
value.description: The female threaded end of a device.

value.name: pin
value.description: The male threaded end of a device.

value.name: other
value.description: This, by exclusion, tells a user to look elsewhere than on the body or near the ends of a component.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagNumberingScheme
enumList.description: Defines the specifications for creating equipment tags.

value.name: EPC64
value.description: RFID - Electronic Product Code, 64 bit.

value.name: EPC96
value.description: RFID - Electronic Product Code, 96 bit.

value.name: MSRCID
value.description: RFID - Merrick Systems Rapid Component Identification.

value.name: ANSI/AIM-BC2
value.description: Barcode - 1995, Uniform Symbology Specification

value.name: ANSI/AIM-BC6
value.description: Barcode - 1995, Uniform Symbology Multi Row Specification

value.name: ANSI/AIM-BC10
value.description: Barcode - 1996, International Symbology Specification - MaxiCode

value.name: EAN.UCC
value.description: Barcode - Composite Symbology

value.name: F2F
value.description: Magnetic - ISO/IEC 7811

value.name: MFM
value.description: Magnetic - 'Modified Frequency Modulation for Magnetic Stripes' standard developed by AIM Inc.

value.name: serial number
value.description: Serial number contains a code which does not require any further knowledge of an encoding scheme to manipulate or process. The identifier is the only information in the 'tag'.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: NameTagTechnology
enumList.description: Defines the mechanisms for attaching an equipment tag to an item.

value.name: tagged
value.description: Independent identification components attached or embedded to a larger component for purposes of identification of the larger component. Tags typically use electronic, radio or sound based technologies and that require a special non-optical device to read them. Radio Frequency Identification (RFID tags) are of this type, as are some magnetic and sound based identification technologies.

value.name: labeled
value.description: An optical label attached to a component. The label may be glued, riveted or attached by some other method and may contain a serial number, barcode or other optically recognized information. Note that a label may possibly have a combination of identifiers associated with it, such as a serial number, a barcode and an embedded RFID identifier. This would generate three nameTags for the one physical label, two of type 'label' for the barcode and serial number and one of type 'tagged' for the RFID identifier.

value.name: intrinsic
value.description: Identification technologies where the intrinsic properties of the component to be identified contain the identification information and no other unique code has been added. For example, some magnetic identification technologies use grooves machined into a component. Some components may also be identified, for example, by their individual sonic signature or optical profile.

value.name: stamped
value.description: An identification code physically stamped into the base material of the component to be identified. Note that if a serial number is stamped into a label attached to a component, 'labeled' should be used and not 'stamped'. Stamped identifiers can wear off but can not fall off.

value.name: painted
value.description: Painted or stenciled on the material.

value.name: temporary
value.description: Temporary identification codes marked with grease pencil, chalk, or such.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: QualifierType
enumList.description: These values represent the type of qualifier in lithology. HISTORY: Issue 1.3.1-34, deprecated 39 values and added 31 values. Added new elements for version, deprecated, replacedBy, lithoType, lithoVariant.

value.name: anhydrite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles the evaporite mineral anhydrite (CaSO4).

value.name: anhydritic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains anhydrite.

value.name: argillaceous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises particles less than 0.0625mm in size, which contain or resemble clay or rock flour.

value.name: barite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains the mineral barite [baryte] (BaSO4).

value.name: belemnites
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains belemnite (Carboniferous - Eocene) fossils or fragments thereof.

value.name: belemnitic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains belemnite fossils or fragments thereof.

value.name: bioturbated
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by organisms before consolidation.

value.name: bioturbation
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by the (burrowing) activities of organisms before consolidation of the sediment.

value.name: bitumen
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling bitumen (asphalt), pitch or tar.

value.name: bituminous
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains bituminous material.

value.name: bryozoans
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or is characteristic of bryozoan (Ordovician - Recent) fossils or fragments thereof.

value.name: burrowed
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by burrowing organisms before consolidation.

value.name: burrows
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has been disturbed by burrowing organisms before consolidation of the sediment.

value.name: calcareous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or characteristic of calcium carbonate (CaCO3).

value.name: calcite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the crystalline form of calcium carbonate (CaCO3).

value.name: calcite concr
value.description: DEPRECATED. See "calcite concretion".

value.name: calcite concretion
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rounded nodules of crystalline calcium carbonate.

value.name: carbonaceous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or yielding carbon.

value.name: chalk
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling a soft compact form of calcium carbonate (CaCO3).

value.name: chalky
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has a chalk content.

value.name: chamosite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles chamosite, a generally greenish-gray or black silicate mineral of iron and aluminium.

value.name: chert
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles the microcrystalline or cryptocrystalline form of quartz (SiO2).

value.name: chlorite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles chlorite, a generally green or black flaky phyllosilicate mineral.

value.name: coal
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains material resembling an organoclastic sedimentary rock, comprising more than 50% by weight of carbonaceous material composed mainly of lithified plant remains.

value.name: concretions
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rounded masses of mineral material.

value.name: conglomerate
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rounded rock fragments of greater than 20mm in size.

value.name: conglomeratic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains conglomerate rock material.

value.name: coral
value.description: DEPRECATED. See "coral fragments".

value.name: coral fragments
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles corals (late Pre-Cambrian - Recent) and/or coral fragments.

value.name: crinoids
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles crinoids (Mid Cambrian - Recent) and/or crinoid fragments.

value.name: diatoms
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles diatoms and/or diatom fragments.

value.name: dolomite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling a magnesium-rich carbonate mineral of calcium (CaMg(CO3)2).

value.name: dolomite concretion
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology has rounded nodules of dolomite (CaMg(CO3)2).

value.name: dolomite stringer
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains thin beds of dolomite (CaMg(CO3)2).

value.name: dolomitic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has a dolomite content.

value.name: feldspar
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the rock-forming aluminosilicate minerals of sodium, potassium or calcium.

value.name: ferruginous
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling minerals rich in iron oxide or iron hydroxide.

value.name: fissile
value.description: DEPRECATED. the term 'fissile' doesn't belong in this list as it is neither qualifier or modifier .... it is a descriptor of 'grain fabric'.

value.name: forams
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains marine micro-organisms of the order Foraminifera (Devonian - Recent), having a calcareous shell.

value.name: forams undifferentiated
value.description: DEPRECATED. see forams.

value.name: fossil fragment
value.description: DEPRECATED. see fossil fragments.

value.name: fossil fragments
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains material comprised of fossils or fossil fragments.

value.name: fossils undifferentiated
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains material comprised of fossils or fossil fragments of undetermined type type, form or species.

value.name: gilsonite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains material containing or resembling gilsonite (uintaite), a brilliant black variety of asphalt occurring in rounded masses.

value.name: glauconite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the generally greenish authogenic clay mineral glauconite.

value.name: glauconitic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology is glauconitic.

value.name: gravel
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains particles in the size range of 2mm - 20mm.

value.name: gravelly
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains gravel sized particles.

value.name: gypsiferous
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains significant gypsum content.

value.name: gypsum
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the evaporite mineral gypsum (CaSO4.2H2O).

value.name: halite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or resembles the common evaporite mineral Halite (NaCl).

value.name: illite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the common clay mineral illite.

value.name: kaolinite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling the common clay mineral kaolinite.

value.name: lignite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling a soft brownish-black form of coal.

value.name: limestone stringer
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains thin beds of limestone.

value.name: lithic fragment
value.description: DEPRECATED. see lithic fragments.

value.name: lithic fragments
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of undetermined rock fragments.

value.name: marcasite
value.description: Indicates that the associate lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of the white (gem) form of iron pyrites (FeS).

value.name: marl
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of a crumbly mixture of clays, calcium and magnesium carbonates.

value.name: marly
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains marl.

value.name: mica
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of mica, a group of hydrous aluminosilicate minerals that split easily into thin partly-transparent sheets.

value.name: microfossil
value.description: DEPRECATED. see microfossils.

value.name: microfossils
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains undifferentiated microscopic fossils.

value.name: no description
value.description: DEPRECATED. where's the validity of creating a null entry for either qualifier or modifer?.

value.name: none
value.description: DEPRECATED. where's the validity of creating a null entry for either qualifier or modifer?.

value.name: oncolite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology is largely composed of oncoliths (oncoids).

value.name: oncolith
value.description: DEPRECATED. see oncoliths.

value.name: oncolithic
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains oncolites.

value.name: oncoliths
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of oncoliths (oncoids), a type of carbonate-coated grain with irregular laminae.

value.name: ooid or oolith
value.description: DEPRECATED. see ooids.

value.name: ooids
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or characteristic of ooids (ooliths), small round grains consisting of calcium carbonate, silica, or dolomite.

value.name: ostracods
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling ostracod (Cambrian - Recent) fossils.

value.name: pebble
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rounded rock fragments in the size range of 2mm - 64mm.

value.name: pebbly
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated material contains pebble sized particles.

value.name: pellet
value.description: DEPRECATED. See "pellets".

value.name: pelletal
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains pellets or fragments of pellets.

value.name: pellets
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or is characteristic of small ovoid or spherical particles of microcrystalline calcite, in the size range 0.03mm - 0.15mm.

value.name: peloid
value.description: DEPRECATED. see peloids.

value.name: peloidal
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains peloids.

value.name: peloids
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or is characteristic of sand-size grains of carbonate mud.

value.name: phosphate
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains phosphates.

value.name: pisolite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology is composed largely of pisoliths (pisoids).

value.name: pisolith
value.description: DEPRECATED. see pisoliths.

value.name: pisoliths
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains or is characteristic of sub-spherical usually carbonate coated grains, of diameter greater than 2mm.

value.name: plant remains
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains remains of a probable botanical origin.

value.name: pyrite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling the sulphide mineral of iron (FeS2).

value.name: quartz
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (crystalline) material containing or resembling the common silica mineral quartz (SiO2).

value.name: radiolaria
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling fossils of the marine protozoan order of Radiolaria (Cambrian - Recent), generally with endoskeletons of opaline silica.

value.name: rootlets
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling plant roots, or structures (rhizoliths) resulting from the mineralization of plant roots by accumulation/cementation or replacement.

value.name: salt
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (crystalline) material containing or resembling rock salts of sodium or potassium (NaCl or KCl).

value.name: salty
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains rock salt or halite.

value.name: sand
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (crystalline) material containing or resembling mineral or rock grains of diameter in the range of 0.625mm - 2mm.

value.name: sandy
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has a sand content.

value.name: shell
value.description: DEPRECATED. see shell fragments.

value.name: shell fragments
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling shells (generally bivalves) or fragments thereof.

value.name: siderite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling siderite (spathic iron), a carbonate mineral of iron (FeCO3).

value.name: siderite concretion
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology contains rounded masses comprised of the mineral siderite (spathic iron), a carbonate mineral of iron (FeCO3).

value.name: silt
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material of very fine particles intermediate in size between clay and sand (0.0625mm - 2mm).

value.name: silty
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology has a silt content.

value.name: spicular
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains spicules.

value.name: spicule
value.description: DEPRECATED. see spicules.

value.name: spicules
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling minute needle-like structures of silica or carbonate, such as that supporting the soft tissue of certain invertebrates, especially sponges.

value.name: stylolite
value.description: DEPRECATED. see stylolites.

value.name: stylolites
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling a contact zone surface between two adjacent calcareous rocks, along which dissolution by pressure solution has ocurred and appearing in cross section as a series of jagged interlocking up-and-down projections (of insoluble clay minerals) that resemble a suture.

value.name: stylolitic
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains stylolites.

value.name: tuff
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises (matrix) material containing or resembling pyroclastic detrital material (volcanic ash).

value.name: tuffaceous
value.description: DEPRECATED. Indicates that the associated lithology contains pyroclastic detrital material (tuff).

value.name: tuffite
value.description: Indicates that the associated lithology comprises material containing or resembling a fine grained matrix of volcanic breccia with intruded grains of fluidized sediment.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: RealtimeData
enumList.description: These values represent the name of a recording channel.

value.name: acetylene
value.description: Acetylene content of the sample (cycle-based)

value.name: activity
value.description: A WITSML activity name indicating what activity is currently being performed on the rig. IT IS ESSENTIAL that this information be as accurate and current as possible. Added via Issue

value.name: activity WITS
value.description: Code indicating what activity is currently being performed on the rig. IT IS ESSENTIAL that this information be as accurate and current as possible. Use the integer codes shown in WITS Appendix E.

value.name: annular velocity (maximum)
value.description: Calculated maximum velocity of the drilling fluid in the annulus.

value.name: annular velocity (minimum)
value.description: Calculated minimum velocity of the drilling fluid in the annulus.

value.name: anti-Stokes intensity
value.description: Anti-Stokes intensity values from a Distributed Temperature Survey.

value.name: azimuth corrected
value.description: Borehole azimuth measured by the directional sensor relative to true north, i.e. corrected for declination.

value.name: azimuth uncorrected
value.description: Borehole azimuth measured by the directional sensor relative to local magnetic north.

value.name: bit jet impact force
value.description: Force exerted on the bottom of the hole by the flow of fluid through the bit.

value.name: bit pressure loss
value.description: Calculated pressure differential across the bit.

value.name: bit revolutions, cumulative
value.description: Measured/calculated running total of the bit revolutions while on bottom. This does not include reaming time. For a re run bit, it is the total revolutions since the last trip.

value.name: bit total measured depth
value.description: Measured depth at the end of the bit run (null if bit run not over).

value.name: block position
value.description: Measured distance of the traveling block above the rotary table.

value.name: build rate
value.description: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

value.name: caliper
value.description: Value of the Caliper sensor.

value.name: carbon dioxide (average)
value.description: Carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, averaged over the interval.

value.name: carbon dioxide (cycle-based)
value.description: Carbon dioxide content of the sample. (cycle-based)

value.name: carbon dioxide (maximum)
value.description: Maximum carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, over the interval.

value.name: carbon dioxide (minimum)
value.description: Minimum carbon dioxide content of the returning mud sample, over the interval.

value.name: cation exchange capacity
value.description: The cation exchange capacity of a sample, measured using the methylene blue titration method.

value.name: cavings
value.description: That proportion of the cuttings which are interpreted to be cavings.

value.name: cementing cement volume
value.description: Cumulative volume of cement pumped (all batches in the current stage) at the time the record is generated.

value.name: cementing cumulative returns
value.description: Cumulative calculated/measured returns since the start of the cement job. This does not include mud circulation prior to pumping cement or spacer

value.name: cementing density in (average)
value.description: Measured density of the fluid entering the well, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing density out (average)
value.description: Measured density of the fluid leaving the well, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing ECD at casing shoe
value.description: Effective circulating density, at the casing shoe measured depth, of the fluids currently in the hole.

value.name: cementing flow rate in (average)
value.description: Flow rate of the fluid entering the hole, measured with a flow sensor, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing flow rate in (calculated)
value.description: Flow rate of the fluid entering the hole, based on strokes per minute, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing flow rate out (average)
value.description: Flow rate of the fluid leaving the hole, measured with a flow sensor, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing flow rate out (calculated)
value.description: Flow rate of the fluid leaving the hole, based on strokes per minute, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing flow rate out (relative)
value.description: Percent of flow out as measured by a paddle or target sensor in the flow line, where 0% = no flow, 100% = full deflection of the sensor.

value.name: cementing fluid type
value.description: Type/batch of fluid currently being pumped. An integer number indicates the fluid type and a letter (ie. A,B,C etc.) indicates the batch. Type codes are: 1=Drilling fluid, 2=Spacer, 3=Cement, 4=Displacement. The coding sequence for a cement job could look like this: 1A, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B, 4A, etc.

value.name: cementing individual volume
value.description: Cumulative volume of fluid pumped, for the current individual type/batch, at the time the record is generated. This number should be reset to zero whenever the fluid type or batch changes.

value.name: cementing job type
value.description: Type of cementing job being performed. Valid types are: 1=Casing, 2=Liner, 3=Plug, 4=Squeeze.

value.name: cementing plugs
value.description: Number/status of all plugs for the current stage. Number the plugs in sequential order starting with the first plug that will be released (i.e. bottom plug (1), middle plug (2), top plug (3)). The status is either loaded (L) or dropped (D) (ie. 1D2L3L).

value.name: cementing pump pressure (average)
value.description: Measured pump pressure, averaged over the interval. This is the pressure required to displace fluid down the hole during the entire cementing operation (ie. rig pump pressure, cement truck pump pressure, etc.).

value.name: cementing stage
value.description: Current stage number of the cementing operation (i.e. 1 , 2, 3, etc.).

value.name: cementing temperature in (average)
value.description: Measured temperature of the fluid entering the well, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing temperature out (average)
value.description: Measured temperature of the fluid leaving the well, averaged over the interval.

value.name: cementing total volume
value.description: Cumulative volume of spacer, cement and displacement fluid pumped (current stage) at the time the record is generated.

value.name: cementing volume to bump plug
value.description: Calculated volume required for the plug to bump.

value.name: chkPrAv
value.description: DEPRECATED. Use "choke pressure (average)".

value.name: choke pressure (average)
value.description: Measured casing (choke) pressure, averaged over the interval.

value.name: conductivity
value.description: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

value.name: conductivity of mud in (average)
value.description: Conductivity of the mud entering the hole, averaged over the interval.

value.name: conductivity of mud out (average)
value.description: Average conductivity of the returning mud sample. Conductivity of the mud leaving the hole, averaged over the interval.

value.name: connection gas (average)
value.description: Average value of connection gas since the last record was generated.

value.name: connection gas (last)
value.description: Value of the last connection gas recorded.

value.name: connection gas (maximum)
value.description: Maximum value of connection gas since the last record was generated.

value.name: connections done
value.description: Number of connections made on the current trip.

value.name: connections remaining
value.description: Number of connections remaining on the current trip.

value.name: cost per distance
value.description: Cumulative per distance cost to drill from a specified point (i.e. normally the start of the current bit run) to the current depth.

value.name: cost per distance (average)
value.description: Average per distance cost to drill the interval since the last record was generated.

value.name: cumulative time on bit
value.description: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

value.name: density
value.description: XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

value.name: density shale
value.description: The density of a representative shale sample taken from the cuttings, measured using a shale density kit.

value.name: diameter of bit
value.description: Diameter of the center jet (nozzle). If bit has more than 5 jets, enter null here and enter Total Flow Area instead.

value.name: distance drilled by bit
value.description: Total distance drilled for the current bit run. For a re run bit, this is only the distance drilled since the last full trip.

value.name: dogleg severity
value.description: Rate of change of hole angle and/or direction evaluated between the current survey point and the next shallowest survey point (for the current pass number).

value.name: drilling exponent (corrected)
value.description: The calculated drilling exponent (corrected) at the time the record is generated. (Jordan and Shirley drilling exponent, with Rehm and McClendon correction for mud density/ECD)

value.name: DST bottom hole pressure
value.description: Pressure recorded at the bottom of the hole. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST bottom hole temperature
value.description: Temperature recorded at the bottom of the hole. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST cumulative gas production
value.description: Total gas production up to the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST cumulative liquid production
value.description: Total liquid production up to the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST cumulative total production
value.description: Total production up to the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST gas flow rate
value.description: Measured gas flow rate at the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST hydrogen sulfide (average)
value.description: Measured concentration of hydrogen sulfide at the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST identifier
value.description: Identifier assigned to current DST. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST liquid flow rate
value.description: Measured liquid flow rate at the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST surface pressure in casing
value.description: Pressure recorded inside the casing at the surface. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST surface pressure in tubing
value.description: Pressure recorded inside the tubing at the surface. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST surface temperature in tubing
value.description: Temperature recorded inside the tubing at the surface. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST tool time
value.description: Time elapsed since the tool began running. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DST total flow rate
value.description: Measured total flow rate at the time the record is generated. (during a drill stem testing operation.)

value.name: DTS temperature
value.description: The temperature that was calculated from Distributed Temperature Survey data.

value.name: ECD at bit depth
value.description: Effective circulating density, at the current bit measured depth, of the fluids currently in the hole.

value.name: ECD at casing shoe depth
value.description: Effective circulating density, at the casing shoe measured depth, of the fluids currently in the hole.

value.name: pass number
value.description: Sequential number assigned to repeated MWD logging runs over the same hole interval. The original hole should have a pass number of 0. Any new hole drilled should have a pass number of 0. Repeat logging sections in a hole should have the pass number incremented by 1. Except for returning to 0 for new sections, the pass number will always increment for each repeat section. As an example: A hole is drilled from 2000m to 4000m with pass number 0. It is decided to repeat log the section from 3500m to 4000m. The pass number is 1 for this section. New hole is again drilled from 4000m. The pass number returns to 0. After drilling to 5000m, it is decided to relog the section from 3500m to 5000m. The pass number for this section is 2. Following this, another repeat log is taken from 4800m to 5000m. This pass is number 3.

enumList.name: TrajStnCalcAlgorithm
enumList.description: The type of algorithm used in the calculation of a trajectory station dependent data. This is traditionally positional information except for the cases of inertial survey data. See API Bulletin D20 "BULLETIN ON DIRECTIONAL DRILLING SURVEY CALCULATION METHODS AND TERMINOLOGY", First Edition December 31, 1985.

value.name: constant tool face
value.description: An algorithm used to design a well trajectory during the planning stage

value.name: minimum curvature
value.description: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is that of a circular arc in 3-D space. Also known as "Minimum Radius Of Curvature" method.

value.name: tangential
value.description: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is a straight line oriented according to the seconds stations orientation. Also known as "Backward Station" and "Terminal Angle" methods.

value.name: balanced tangential
value.description: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is along two straight lines, with the first section oriented according to the first stations orientation and the second line oriented according to the second stations orientation. Each line segment is set to have a length of half the measured depth difference between the two stations. Also known as "Acceleration", "Secant", "Trapezoidal", and "Vector Averaging" methods.

value.name: average angle
value.description: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path between stations is along a straight line oriented according to the average of the inclination and azimuth orientations of the start and end stations. Also known as "Angle Averaging" method.

value.name: radius of curvature
value.description: An algorithm used to calculate the well trajectory spatial position (X,Y,Z) at execution stage or planning stage. The assumed path is a helix with a fixed vertical radius wrapped around a cylinder of fixed radius. Both radii can tend to infinity yielding simple circular arcs in either the horizontal or vertical planes.

value.name: inertial
value.description: This encompasses surveying methods where the positional data was not derived from a transformation of MD,INC,AZM, but are provided directly by some other mechanism such as direct positional output from an inertial gyro system.

value.name: custom
value.description: This encompasses methodologies which are similar to the Inertial method in that they are direct populations of the positional data, which have been determined by some other possibly non-published methodology.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.

enumList.name: TypeSurveyTool
enumList.description: Type of directional survey tool; a very generic classification.

value.name: magnetic MWD
value.description: A tool measuring downhole inclination and azimuth from sets of accelerometers and magnetometers sensors.

value.name: magnetic multiple-shot
value.description: A tool measuring downhole inclination and azimuth from photo-mechanical inclinometers and magnetic compass.

value.name: unknown
value.description: The value is not known. This value should not be used in normal situations. All reasonable attempts should be made to determine the appropriate value. Use of this value may result in rejection in some situations.
